content.description:
The right arete of the front face from a sit start. 

  Left hand starts on a good square crimp and right low on the arete, make tension moves up the arete on crimps. Top out on jugs. 

  Good foot work and core tension are the key for this one.
content.location: On the face that faces the road, this climbs the right arete on crimps to a copout on jugs.

content.description:
Start with the hands hanging on right side of the crevice. Left foot starts on bottom-left jut of crevice. Right foot starts smeared on right slab of crevice. First move is a right hand up to the top of the right crevice. After a left foot placed by the starting handholds, the rest of the route involves traversing the crack to the left and to the top. 

  Until a proper beta is discovered, the difficulty is moving horizontally along the crack while smearing the feet along the slab because there aren't many options for footholds with the exception of a few notches, if you can call them that.
content.location: Crevice to the right of "Sting Like a Bee"

content.description: Start with hands at the bend of the bottom crack (see photo). Start feet smeared on the slab. First move is a left hand to the horizontal crack above starting holds. Place a right foot on the tooth of the crack to flag up to the nice crimp to the right. Proper footwork and moving your right hip to the wall will help you undercling to a higher crack and stand up to reach the top with the left hand. After that, it is a simple top-out.
content.protection: Crashpad    NOTE: Be careful on the top-out/getting down since the top of the boulder is a "saddle"
content.location: Further down the slab to the right of "Sting Like a Bee"

content.description: This is the obvious shelf running left to right on the boulder. Start sitting on the rock and make traversing moves up the shelf to a crux-y move at the 3/4 mark. Top out around the right arete on jugs.
content.location: One the face that faces the road, this is the obvious shelf that runs from left to right. Top out around the right arete.

content.description:
A boulder that stands alone in the woods. It has two obvious lives that climb the triangle shaped overhanging face that faces the road. Sadly someone had a fire under the face leaving black soot however, the holds are all still solid. 

  More potential exists on the slabby sides.
